name: guardianshield
description: Universal AI security layer â€” code scanning, PII detection, prompt injection defense, secret detection, dependency auditing, and audit logging.

tools.name: scan_code
tools.description: Scan source code for security vulnerabilities (SQL injection, XSS, command injection, path traversal) and hardcoded secrets/credentials. Returns a list of findings with severity, type, and remediation guidance.

file_path.description: Optional file path for context in findings.

tools.name: scan_input
tools.description: Check user or agent input for prompt injection attempts. Detects instruction override, role hijacking, system prompt extraction, delimiter abuse, ChatML injection, jailbreak keywords, and encoding evasion.

text.description: The input text to check for injection attempts.

tools.name: scan_output
tools.description: Check AI-generated output for PII leaks (email, SSN, credit card, phone, IP) and content policy violations (violence, self-harm, illegal activity). PII is automatically redacted in findings.

text.description: The AI output text to scan.

tools.name: check_secrets
tools.description: Dedicated secret and credential detection. Scans text for AWS keys, GitHub tokens, Stripe keys, private keys, JWTs, Slack tokens, passwords, connection strings, Google API keys, and more. All matched secrets are redacted in findings.

text.description: The text to scan for secrets.

tools.name: get_profile
tools.description: Get the current safety profile configuration including scanner settings and blocked content categories.

tools.name: set_profile
tools.description: Switch to a different safety profile. Available profiles: general, education, healthcare, finance, children. Each profile adjusts scanner sensitivity and blocked categories.

tools.name: audit_log
tools.description: Query the security audit log. Returns recent scan events with timestamps, scan types, finding counts, and input hashes.

scan_type.description: Filter by scan type: code, input, output, secrets.

limit.description: Maximum number of entries to return (default 50).

tools.name: get_findings
tools.description: Retrieve past security findings from the audit database with optional filters by type, severity, or audit ID.

audit_id.description: Filter findings by audit log entry ID.

finding_type.description: Filter by finding type (e.g. secret, sql_injection, pii_leak).

tools.name: shield_status
tools.description: Get GuardianShield health and configuration status including active profile, enabled scanners, and audit statistics.

tools.name: scan_file
tools.description: Scan a single source file for vulnerabilities and secrets. Auto-detects language from file extension. Returns findings with line numbers, severity, CWE IDs, and remediation.

path.description: Absolute or relative path to the file.

tools.name: scan_directory
tools.description: Recursively scan a directory for vulnerabilities and secrets. Supports extension filtering, exclude patterns, and reports progress. Returns all findings across all scanned files.

tools.name: test_pattern
tools.description: Test a regex pattern against sample code. Returns match details including positions and matched text. Useful for developing and debugging custom vulnerability patterns.

language.description: Optional language context for the pattern.

tools.name: check_dependencies
tools.description: Check package dependencies for known vulnerabilities using the OSV.dev database. Provide a list of packages with names, versions, and ecosystems (PyPI or npm).

tools.name: sync_vulnerabilities
tools.description: Sync the local OSV vulnerability database for a given ecosystem. Call this to update the cache before checking dependencies.

ecosystem.description: Ecosystem to sync (PyPI, npm, Go, or Packagist).

packages.description: Optional list of package names to sync.

tools.name: parse_manifest
tools.description: Parse a dependency manifest file into a structured list of dependencies. Auto-detects format from the filename. Supports: requirements.txt, package.json, pyproject.toml, package-lock.json, yarn.lock, pnpm-lock.yaml, Pipfile.lock, go.mod, go.sum, composer.json, composer.lock.

content.description: The contents of the manifest file.

tools.name: scan_dependencies
tools.description: Recursively scan a directory for manifest/lockfiles (requirements.txt, package.json, go.mod, composer.json, etc.), parse dependencies, and check them for known vulnerabilities using the OSV.dev database.

path.description: Root directory to scan for manifest files.

prompts.name: security-review
prompts.description: Perform a comprehensive security review of code. Scans for vulnerabilities, secrets, and provides remediation guidance.

prompts.name: compliance-check
prompts.description: Check text for compliance with the active safety profile. Scans for PII, content violations, and policy adherence.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The text to check for compliance.
